cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 101 (Friday, June 9, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. YAKYM:H.R. 3999.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 1 of the United StatesConstitutionThe single subject of this legislation is:This legislation would provide for reliquidation of dutiespaid on certain previous entries of golf cart tires.[Page H2791]

item.title: A bill to provide for the reliquidation of certain entries of golf cart tires.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.
Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

cdata.text:
This bill provides for the reliquidation of certain golf cart tires imported into the United States during specified time periods. U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) defines liquidation as the final computation or ascertainment of duties on entries for consumption or drawback entries.

Within 90 days of this bill's enactment, CBP must

  • reliquidate each entry of K389 Hole-N-One golf cart tires at the rate of duty applicable to such tires under subheading 4011.69.00 of the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States (the general rate of duty for this subheading is free) on the date of entry, and
  • refund with interest any duties previously paid with respect to the entry.

bill.title: To provide for the reliquidation of certain entries of golf cart tires.

item.title: To provide for the reliquidation of certain entries of golf cart tires.
To provide for the reliquidation of certain entries of golf cart tires.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
